dialogs.createDescription: Enter the details for the new organisation. Click Save when you're done.
dialogs.editProfileDescription: Update the name and description. Click Save when you're done.
dialogs.editTaskDescription: Update the task name and description.
dialogs.addProfileDescription: Search and select a profile to assign to this organization.
dialogs.addTaskDescription: Search and select a task to assign to this organization.
dialogs.removeTaskDescription: This will unlink the task from the current organization (set organizationId to null). The task record itself will remain in the system. This action cannot be undone.
dialogs.removeProfileDescription: This will unlink the profile from the current organization (set organizationId to null). The profile record itself will remain in the system. This action cannot be undone.
dialogs.deleteDescription: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete the organization "{name}" and remove it from the system.
dialogs.bulkDeleteDescription: You are about to delete {count} organizations. This action cannot be undone.
dialogs.bulkDeleteConfirmCheckbox: I understand that this will permanently delete the selected organizations and all associated data.

helpers.uploadDirectoryHelp: Directory where uploaded files are temporarily stored
helpers.downloadDirectoryHelp: Directory where files are prepared for download
helpers.artifactDirectoryHelp: Directory where artifact files are permanently stored
helpers.organizationSizeHelp: EU SME classification based on employee count
helpers.naceSectionHelp: NACE classification used across EU for statistics and regulations
helpers.euTaxonomyHelp: Whether activities align with the EU Taxonomy for sustainable activities
helpers.itSecurityStaffHelp: Level of dedicated IT and security staffing in your organization
helpers.securityMaturityHelp: Current maturity level of your security program and practices
helpers.dataSensitivityHelp: Types of sensitive data your organization processes (select all that apply)
helpers.regulatoryObligationsHelp: Applicable regulatory and compliance frameworks (select all that apply)
helpers.itEndpointRangeHelp: Total number of managed IT endpoints (workstations, servers, mobile devices)
helpers.infrastructureTypesHelp: Types of IT infrastructure your organization operates (select all that apply)
helpers.softwareDevelopmentHelp: Scope of in-house software development activities
helpers.publicFacingServicesHelp: Level of internet-exposed services and applications
helpers.targetedAttackLikelihoodHelp: Likelihood of being specifically targeted by threat actors
helpers.downtimeToleranceHelp: Business impact tolerance for system unavailability
helpers.supplyChainPositionHelp: Your position in the supply chain relative to end customers
helpers.securityBudgetRangeHelp: Approximate annual budget allocated to security

nace.D: D - Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning
nace.E: E - Water supply, sewerage, waste management
nace.M: M - Professional, scientific and technical activities
nace.N: N - Administrative and support service activities
nace.Q: Q - Human health and social work

twoFactor.title: Two-Factor Authentication
twoFactor.description: Add an extra layer of security to your account by requiring a verification code from your authenticator app when signing in.
twoFactor.setupDescription: Protect your account with TOTP-based two-factor authentication. You will need an authenticator app such as Google Authenticator, Authy, or 1Password.
twoFactor.scanQrCode: Scan this QR code with your authenticator app
twoFactor.saveBackupCodes: Save your backup codes. Store them in a safe place — each code can only be used once.
twoFactor.enterVerificationCode: Enter the 6-digit code from your authenticator app to confirm setup.
twoFactor.regenerateDescription: If you have lost your backup codes, you can regenerate new ones.
twoFactor.newBackupCodes: Your new backup codes — save them now:
twoFactor.disableWarning: Are you sure you want to disable two-factor authentication? This will make your account less secure.

SettingsApplication.title: Application Settings
SettingsApplication.subtitle: Manage global application settings. Changes will apply to all users.

helpers.applicationName: The name displayed throughout the application
helpers.homeDirectory: Base directory for application files and data
helpers.pollingInterval: How often the application automatically refreshes data (minimum 1000ms)

infoBox.title: Settings Information
infoBox.description: These settings affect all users. The polling interval controls how frequently the application checks for new messages, tasks, and other updates. Lower values provide more real-time updates but increase server load.

toast.pollingIntervalMin: Polling interval must be at least 1000ms (1 second)
